links.quantification: Rail shift reduces logistics cost 14% → 11% of GDP → ₹2L Cr/year savings → improves export competitiveness
45% rail share → 100M tonnes off roads → 40% reduction in highway corridor PM2.5 and NOx emissions
Rail 4x more fuel-efficient → modal shift saves 25 MT diesel/year → reduces import bill by ₹1.5L Cr
Fewer trucks → 30% reduction in highway congestion → improves urban periphery traffic flow → reduces logistics time by 15%
Freight lobby resistance: ₹50/ton-km tax → trucking industry ₹50K Cr revenue loss → political pressure against implementation
Rail capacity gap: Perishable goods need cold chain + speed → rail infrastructure lags → forces road dependence for food
Carbon tax → rail shift → rail infrastructure investment → better service → more freight shifts (reinforcing cycle)
Requires rail capacity expansion: Modal shift needs 50% more rail freight capacity → ₹3L Cr investment → 5-year buildout
Via emissions reduction: Lower NOx → reduced acid deposition → forest health improves → ecosystem resilience
Via congestion relief: Faster logistics → 15% reduction in food spoilage during transport → fresher produce in cities
Fewer highway trucks → 50% reduction in wildlife roadkill → corridor restoration becomes viable → habitat connectivity
